The majestic buddhas of the ten directions, the majestic king among sages,
With the thirty-two excellent marks and the eighty minor marks,
Emitting wondrous light from the body, universally illuminating the ten directions,
I vow to offer my body and life, bowing to the kings of the Dharma.
The majestic buddhas of the ten directions, with immeasurable great compassion,
Forming and establishing great vows, delivering all sentient beings,
The one who joyfully hears much, whose merits are beyond measure,
I vow to offer my body and life, bowing to the great compassion.
The majestic buddhas of the ten directions, whose merits are immeasurable,
Wisdom is like an immeasurable ocean, irrigating and nourishing the ten directions.
Those who hear its name will eliminate faults and dispel all calamities.
I take refuge in great wisdom, and bow my head to the king of right enlightenment.
The majestic buddhas of the ten directions have extremely pure lands.
Adorned with the seven treasures, with the shapes of wondrous fragrances and sandalwood,
They are all pure bodhisattvas, and there is no mention of the two vehicles.

The majestic buddhas of the ten directions are the treasures of the path of the three times.
Those who hear it and joyfully believe will quickly accomplish the unsurpassed truth.
They will roam in the bodhisattva path, firmly abiding in irreversibility.
Wherever they are born, they will always see the Buddha and quickly encounter the World-Honored Ones.
The majestic buddhas of the ten directions are the guides of the three times.
With a sincere mind, harboring respect, joyfully believing without doubt,
The one who is born is always upright, with a very radiant countenance,
With unique eloquence and wisdom, I wish to pay homage to the Teacher of Gods and Humans.
There are also four bodhisattvas. These four great beings were all the teachers of the buddhas of the ten directions in the past.
When these four great beings first began their practice, they made a great vow, saying:
We will deliver all sentient beings, until they all attain nirvana, and only then will we attain buddhahood.
For this reason, one should recite and chant them, and attain immeasurable and boundless merit up to irreversibility.
It is like the entire world system of a billion worlds, with all its empty space filled with purple gold, and using it as an offering;
It is not as good as reciting the names of these four great beings for a short while, and the merit one attains surpasses that of offering so much gold by a thousand billion times.
Their names are:
Bodhisattva Who Casts Off Hindrances, Bodhisattva of Tranquil Faculties, Bodhisattva of Wisdom and Power, and Bodhisattva Who Never Leaves.
